I would recommend "Lockout" for action fans who enjoy a fast-paced and thrilling movie. The plot revolves around eight unlikely teenagers band together to fight, which will definitely keep the audience engaged and entertained throughout the movie.
Another great recommendation is "Tomorrow, When the War Began". This movie is based on true events that happened during World War II in Australia. The plot revolves around a group of men who are not officially soldiers but are part of a secret resistance organization in Australia during World War II. These men are tasked with sabotaging German military operations and infrastructure in Australia during World War II.

conversation.text:
Based on the preferences provided, I would recommend both Terminator Salvation and Monsters vs. Aliens.

Terminator Salvation is a science fiction film directed by Christian Bahn in 2009. The plot follows John Connor (played by Michael Papajohn) as he tries to stop an alien invasion. The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the performances of its actors and others criticizing the direction of the film and its script. Despite this mixed response from critics, Terminator Salvation has become one of the most well-known science fiction films ever made.

Monsters vs. Aliens is a computer animated science fiction film produced by DreamWorks Animation in 2009. The plot follows the journey of an alien named Dr. Octopus (voiced by Christopher Walken)) who seeks revenge against a group of humans who have accidentally destroyed his home in the ocean. As Dr. Octopus travels to Earth, he meets and forms alliances with several other aliens, including a giant gorilla named B.O.R.N. (voiced by John Lithgow)) who also seek revenge against the humans.
